strategy: Apply a deep neural network (DNN) with multiple hidden layers and batch normalization, using a non-linear activation function (e.g., ReLU) to capture high-dimensional interactions in the data. Train the DNN with early stopping on time-based cross-validation splits and incorporate dropout layers to prevent overfitting. Use a learning rate scheduler to adaptively adjust the training rate during optimization. Introduce custom feature engineering by combining continuous variables (e.g., log-transformed area features) and applying polynomial features up to degree 2 to model non-linear relationships.

from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error
import torch
